name: Fēizhōu Tànxiǎn
summary: Monopoly: Adventure in Africa for the Super A'can

name: Fēngshén Bǎng
summary: A Chinese RPG developed and published by C&E Inc. with the rights now owned by Super Fighter Team.

name: Fēng Shén Yīngjié Chuán
summary: Feng Shen Ying Jie Chuan is an unlicensed tactical-RPG released in 1996 for the Mega Drive, developed by Chuanpu. The game features a Wuxia setting, visually impressive effects and a set of very different characters.

name: Fēng Shén Bǎng
summary:
Fēng Shén Bǎng is a 1996 one-on-one fighting game released for the Famicom throughout Asia. It was also released with a localized label as Myth Struggle, although the in-game content is unchanged. The game is based on the 16th century Chinese epic novel of the same name, also called Fēngshén Yǎnyì (封神演義) and often translated to Investiture of the Gods or The Creation of the Gods.
The game is essentially a hacked version of Hummer Team's earlier bootleg version of DragonBall Z: Super Butōden 2, which was originally released on the Super NES. The change by Waixing was made to legitimize the content as to not run into copyright laws, as this version was also released (although still unlicensed by Nintendo) in Japan and with likely intent to distribute outside of Asia.

name: Fēngsè Huànxiǎng III: ～Zuì Yǔ Fá De Zhèn Hún Gē～
summary: Wind Fantasy 3: The Soul Song Of Sin & Punishment is a strategic role-playing game developed by Hongyu Technology, released on November 17, 2004.

name: Fēngkuáng Pào Pào Bǔyú
summary:
The ultimate fishing game makes its grand debut!
Experience classic fishing gameplay with screen-filling bosses and massive 100,000x multipliers, where coins burst nonstop for endless excitement.

name: Fēng Shén Ràng Wǒ Lái
summary: “Who decides the will of heaven? Why can’t one defy fate and walk against the heavens?”
